review: Actually haven't used it but I use Chrome, which is awesome.  Gave Roku stick to kid as gift and he loves it.  Stupidly, I thought Chrome had a superior feature since it does not come with a remote control; the last thing I needed, I thought, was another remote.  Well, obviously in hindsight, you can too control a Roku via smartphone app OR with a standard remote.  Advantage of remote is that guests with no experience would be hard-pressed to learn the Roku app -- plus I understand there are still people who don't own a phone.  While I'd keep the remote tucked away and strictly use the phone app, the remote controller would be essential for most of my (admittedly dim-witted) guests.Chrome "cast" feature works well BTW.  I guess Roku's rich content renders casting less useful, just mentioning FWIW. Doubt you could go wrong with either.  Note only Roku natively supports Amazon vid.
